Variable Bindings.val: Bind the variable x to value 5
Bind the variable x to value 5 with type i32
Bind the mutable variable x to value 5

Primitive Types.val: Booleans are either true and false

Chars are a single unicode scalar value (4 bytes instead of 1 like in most languages).
 They are declared with a single tick: (')
The 8-bit signed integer type. Ranges -128 to 127
The 16-bit signed integer type. Ranges -32,768 to 32,767
The 32-bit signed integer type. Ranges -2,147,483,648 to 2,147,483,647
The 8-bit unsigned integer type. Ranges from 0 to 255
The 16-bit unsigned integer type. Ranges from 0 to 65,535
The 32-bit unsigned integer type. Ranges from 0 to 4,294,967,295
The 32-bit unsigned integer type. Ranges from 0 to 1.84467440737095 * 10^19
The 32-bit floating point type. IEEE-754 single precision number
The 64-bit floating point type. IEEE-754 double precision number
Arrays are fixed-size list of elements of the same type. They are immutable by default

Primitive Types.key:
let a = \[1, 2, 3\]; 
let s = &a\[..\]; \\ Slice of all of a
Primitive Types.val: A slice is a reference into an array
A tuple is an ordered list of fixed size

Comments.val: Anything after '///' is a doc comment
Another form of doc comment used to comment containing items (e.g crates, modules and functions)
